title.value: Effect of different levels of organo-mineral nutrition and row spacing to productivity and quality of potato at growing for food purpose
Влияние различных уровней органоминерального питания  и ширины междурядий на продуктивность и качество картофеля при возделывании на продовольственные цели

person.name: Khokh, V.A., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Grodno Regional Inst. of Plant Growing

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there was realized the improving the technology of potato cultivation taking into account the influence of organic and mineral fertilizing and row spacing on its productivity and quality. The results of studies on the effect of different levels of organic food and the width of the rows on the productivity and quality of ware potatoes (Solanum tuberosum) were presented. It was found that for the growing of more than 50,0 tons per hectare of tubers of Zhuravinka varieties with high profitability of production without regard to the width of the rows there should be applied the estimated doses of mineral fertilizers on the background of chopped straw + green manure fertilizer. Thus, the use of fertilizers on sod-podzolic sandy loam soil in a dose N90P90K120 on the background of chopped straw + green manure regardless of row spacing contributed to maximizing the yield of middle late variety Zhuravinka with the yield of marketable tubers 87-90%. Level of profitability at the same time was 160, 1-177,8%.
